reviewText: Delightful, quick-paced and marvelously acted Neil Simon effort.  Marsha Mason is at the top of her form carrying the film with her brilliant portrayal of a woman whose irresponsible father (Jason Robards -- excellent) returns to give to his remaining family what he has embezzled after spending 6 years in prison.  The film has several comedic climaxes all due to Mason's responses to Robards, shall we call it, generosity?Please don't miss it now that it has "returned" on a DVD where you're able to see it like it was meant to be viewed when it was initially released.  I saw it when released, and canot believe how much time has passed since then.  I can barely view my tape anymore, it is so worn out.

reviewText: We all love this film.  It's just fun to watch. Everybody needs a laugh once in a while, and Max Dugan's sly wit is good medicine from the 60's for the headaches of this decade, and maybe any decade.  I just wish it was available on dvd again.

reviewText: We were amazed at the quality of the movie. We had it on disc a long, long, long time ago and the kids and I loved it then, and now we are so happy to finally have it back in our collection! If you a Max Dugan Returns fan and have missed having it available to you, buy this!

reviewText: Snappy little Neil Simon comedy about a long-lost father (Jason Robards) who is dying, who suddenly decides to make up for the lost years by showering his daughter and grandson with money and presents, gotten through embezzlement in Las Vegas. Sweet and light, not very deep - but most entertaining. With Marsha Mason as the daughter and Donald Sutherland as her cop boyfriend who finally figures out where the money's coming from and is torn between love and duty. Matthew Broderick is the grandson (his debut). Worth a watch.

reviewText: I've been waiting  for  Max Dugan Returns  to  be  released on DVD ever since I bought my first  DVD player in December 2000. One of the most underrated movies of the 80s.

reviewText: This became a favorite of mine when I discovered Matthew Broderick resembled my first child. I just LOVE this film with the reality-based economics of a single parent - AND a teacher. Jason Robards, Jr. is TRULY the jewel of this film. I recommend this to anyone who wants a happily ever-after (well, sort-of) film with good dialogue and chemistry throughout.
summary: Neil Simon does it so well.

reviewText: another cable classic from early childhood. My introduction to Donald Sutherland and Jason Robards and Matthew Broderick. a story about a mysterious father stranger returning from a long absence to his family a quirky fun happy movie. A rags to comfortable living story of a man who just wants to give to his family and his old age good for children and adults
summary: My introduction to Donald Sutherland and Jason Robards and Matthew Broderick.

reviewText: Just want to say, it's a shame it's not on DVD (unavailable region 1 ony region 2)Max Dugan (Jason Robards) is a man who steals from someone that stole from him.  He is walking around with this satchel ofmoney.  Robards shows up at his daughters (Marsha Mason) house, who is  living in a cramped bungalow which she shares with her teenage son (Matthew Broderick) Robards is not exactly given a warm welcome. The reason is that she hasn't seen him since she was a child. He wants to make up for not being there. So he does a lot of things for her and his grandson with this money.  Buy the movie and you will see what happens when he does this, then throw in Donald Sutherland who is dating her and is also a cop.  It is a hoot.

reviewText: This is one of my favorite movies of all time.  Could not find this anywhere until I checked on Amazon.  Thanks Amazon.  Marsha Mason is one of my favorite actresses.  She's funny and serious at the same time. Matthew Broderick is truly at his best and Marsha Mason is great as his mom.

reviewText: Neil Simon is a superb writer and all of the actors are great in this film. It is not a laugh out loud flick, but it brings a warm enjoyable smile to the viewer's face. Every character in the movie is likable and it is filled with love. Who can ask for anything more? A poor school teacher with a nice son is visited by her father after close to a three decade absence. He brings over $600,000, news that he will be dead in six months, and a strong desire to give his daughter and grandson a good life. The problem is that he stole the money and the police and the gangsters who owned the money are after him. Additionally, his daughter is dating a police lieutenant.

reviewText: Despite the title, there was no movie called Max Dugan, good thing too, because this movie was not that impressive.  My gramps likes it, so I bought it for him, myself, I wasn't impressed.  This movie has a place on everyone's movie shelf, even if only to prop a shelf up on one side so that is even with the other.  All movies are worth watching once, this one rates slightly better then that, but more then a handful in your entire lifetime may be too many.

reviewText: It isn't the best transfer in the world, but it is still such a treat that this funny, wonderful little fable has finally arrived on DVD. The story is simple and perhaps even slight, but this Neil Simon comedy, one he wrote directly for the screen, boasts one of his most enjoyable scripts, terrific performances, witty dialogue and a heartfelt message without in anyway being sentimental. The sparks and chemistry between Jason Robards and Marsha Mason erupt in every scene and the supporting cast, which includes Donald Sutherland and Matthew Broderick in his first film role, is stellar.The original publicity used the line, 'Everybody needs a little Max Dugan. Indeed! Get it and enjoy.
Title: N/A
